title: Disseminated Seminoma: Re-Evaluation of Treatment Protocols
abstract: No AccessJournal of Urology1 Oct 1981Disseminated Seminoma: Re-Evaluation of Treatment Protocols Walter L. Mendenhall, Stephen D. Williams, Lawrence H. Einhorn, and John P. Donohue Walter L. MendenhallWalter L. Mendenhall More articles by this author , Stephen D. WilliamsStephen D. Williams More articles by this author , Lawrence H. EinhornLawrence H. Donohue More articles by this author View All Author Informationhttps://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-5347(17)54593-0AboutPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissionsReprints ShareFacebookLinked InTwitterEmail Radiotherapy provides a high cure rate for patients with stages I and II seminoma but the results for those with stage III disease have been disappointing. We report on 19 patients with high stage seminoma who have been treated with platinum, vinblastine and bleomycin (14 patients) or platinum, vinblastine, bleomycin and doxorubicin hydrochloride (5 patients). Of the 19 patients 12 (63 per cent) had complete remission of the disease and the remaining 7 had partial remission. To date, 11 patients (58 per cent) remain free of disease. Of the 6 patients with no prior irradiation 5 achieved complete remission, while the 1 failure had massive hepatic metastases. The median followup was 19 months (range 12 to 37 months). These results parallel that achieved with the same chemotherapy regimen in patients with stage III nonseminomatous testicular cancer. © 1981 by The American Urological Association Education and Research, Inc.FiguresReferencesRelatedDetailsCited BySmalley S, Earle J, Evans R and Richardson R (2018) Modern Radiotherapy Results with Bulky Stages II and III SeminomaJournal of Urology, VOL. 144, NO. 3, (685-689), Online publication date: 1-Sep-1990.Logothetis C, Samuels M, Ogden S, Dexeus F and Chong C (2018) Cyclophosphamide and Sequential Cisplatin for Advanced Seminoma: Long-Term Followup in 52 PatientsJournal of Urology, VOL. 138, NO. 4 Part 1, (789-794), Online publication date: 1-Oct-1987.Donohue J (2018) Editorial CommentsJournal of Urology, VOL. 129, NO. 2, (305-306), Online publication date: 1-Feb-1983.
